intro: Encholirium bracteatum, commonly known as the Mexican hat plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Agavaceae. It is native to central Mexico and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a succulent perennial, featuring thick, fleshy leaves that are often blue-green in color. It produces tall flowering stalks that can reach up to 2 meters in height, making it a prominent feature in its natural habitat. Encholirium bracteatum is well adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and full sun for optimal growth.
